intro: Austrostipa burgesiana, commonly known as Burge's wiregrass, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that are typically green or pale in color. Austrostipa burgesiana is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and forage for local wildlife.
